definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Nobody thought that he had turned out a great inventor.
sentences.chinese: 没人想到他会变成一位伟大的发明家。

sentences.english: The inventor is exc ITed, and he is going to try out his new machine.
sentences.chinese: 这位发明家很兴奋，他要试一下他的新机器。

sentences.english: Goldman was an inventor, but a practical one.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位发明家，但是是一位非常切实际的人。

sentences.english: In my youth my ambition had been to be an inventor.
sentences.chinese: 在我年轻时我的抱负曾是当一名发明家。

sentences.english: Edison is a great inventor whose fame is world-wide.
sentences.chinese: 爱迪生是一位伟大的发明家，他名扬天下。

sentences.english: The young inventor was badly scalded .
sentences.chinese: 这个小发明家也被严重地烫伤了。

sentences.english: Did that mean I was meant to be an inventor?
sentences.chinese: 但那就表示我注定要成为一个发明家吗？

sentences.english: To these gutty inventor, good luck is omnipresent.
sentences.chinese: 对于这些有勇气的发明家，机遇无所不在。

sentences.english: The Puffin may never fly, but other inventors are tinkering.
sentences.chinese: 也许海雀还不能飞，但其他的发明家仍在努力。

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: HOW many inventions does it take to change a light bulb?
sentences.chinese: 每当人类变革一次灯泡需要多少位发明家？

sentences.english: An inventor in Tokyo recently came out with a miniature telephone.
sentences.chinese: 东京的一个发明家发明了一款微型电话。

sentences.english: What do you mean, win the breakup old-timey inventor?
sentences.chinese: 什么意思，分手赢家？你这个古典发明家。

sentences.english: Unit 15 How Did Edison Become a Great Inventor?
sentences.chinese: 爱迪生缘何成为大发明家？

sentences.english: The young inventor wbritish petroleumostlyly scingded.
sentences.chinese: 这个小发明家也被要紧地烫伤了。

sentences.english: Historically, many scientists and inventors have taken full advantage of daydreaming. Many scientists and inventors in history took full use of daydreaming.
sentences.chinese: 历史上许多科学家与发明家曾充分利用白日梦。

definition: Edison (name)/Thomas Alva Edison (1847-1931), American inventor and businessman
to invent and innovate/inventions and innovations
School of Minor-talks, one of the Hundred Schools of Thought 諸子百家|诸子百家[zhu1 zi3 bai3 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
